question: Question_A_14
statement:
What is the output after the following lines of MATLAB code?

\texttt{A~=~{[}1~2~3;~4~5~6{]};}\\\texttt{A(:,1)}
sols:
The first line of code creates a \emph{2}x\emph{3} matrix with the row
vector {[}1 2 3{]} as its first row and the row vector {[}4 5 6{]} as
its second row. Hence

\begin{align*}A = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \end{array}\right]\end{align*}

The second line tells MATLAB to return a vector of all entries in
\emph{A} that have a second argument \emph{1}, hence \emph{A(1,1)} and
\emph{A(2,1)}. This is a column vector. Therefore the final answer is

\begin{align*}\left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 4 \end{array}\right]\end{align*}
hints:
What is the dimension of \emph{A}? What does the \textbf{;} do when
entering a matrix? Is the output a column or a row vector?
